intro: Perityle specicola, commonly known as the narrowleaf perityle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and open woods. Perityle specicola is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
